text: Whoa that's great. I'm sure you haven't had a chance to play with it yourself, but how do you think that Extract feature compares to the Cut and Slice Me plugin?
Historically I've trusted Photoshop's export features. They always add extra halfpixels or have weird bugs.
I'll have to test with a few different assets before I use it myself.
Maybe it's a good opty to do a follow-up post to <http://uncorkedstudios.com/blog/scaling-down-and-exporting-assets-in-photoshop>

attachments.title: Uncorked Studios Blog Scaling down and exporting assets in Photoshop
attachments.text: A big part of a web or mobile design project is producing great quality cut art to be used in the final product. When working with different pixel densities, one of my main concerns is the quality of scaled artwork being exported. I recently took some time to look at different techniques for exporting and scaling down assets, and wanted to share my findings.
attachments.fallback: Uncorked Studios: Uncorked Studios Blog Scaling down and exporting assets in Photoshop

text: I was thinking about this post and your previous assessment of Generator.
I'm at least excited about universal libraries!
Yes. I like having my own plugin and all, but I like much more that PS is including that now.
The only annoying things is that they went with guides for their grid feature. I still maintain guide shouldn't be used for grids and Photoshop grids should work like InDesign's.
